summary: Gaeton J. Fonzi is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are primarily payroll and certification reports from 1977 and 1978, detailing Fonzi's employment, salary, and position within the committee. While the specific role Fonzi held within the HSCA is not explicitly stated in these documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's activities during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents provide a timeline of his employment from at least January 1977 to November 1978.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Gaeton J. Fonzi's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the JFK assassination. As a staff member, he would have contributed to the committee's research, investigations, and ultimately, its conclusions regarding the assassination. The documents provided offer a glimpse into the operational aspects of the HSCA and the personnel involved.
